questions.question: The lecture was so interesting that the audience sat ……………………….
questions.description: Here the adjective motionless describes the noun audience, not their sitting.

questions.question: The movie I watched yesterday was ………………………….. boring.
questions.description: Fairly is not normally used with negative ideas.

questions.question: Raju worked ……………………. to succeed.
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective and an adverb hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: The ointment ………………………….. his pain.
questions.description: To alleviate pain is to lessen pain.

questions.question: She is a ………………………… woman.
My hen …………………………. twenty eggs last month.
questions.description: When lie means recline, its past tense is lay. Hens lay eggs. The past tense of lay is laid.

questions.question: He is always ……………………….. towards his teachers and elders.
questions.description: Respectful means showing respect respectable means worthy of being respected.

questions.question: They tried to solve the dispute …………………………..
questions.description: Amiable refers to the friendly disposition of people amicable refers to goodwill.

questions.question: We may ……………………….. the game.
questions.description: Loose is the opposite of tight.

questions.question: I would have loved to invite all of my friends to my wedding but it was not ……………………………
questions.description: Practicable means that can be put into practice.

questions.question: He gave a ………………………… account of rural India.
Gandhi believed in the ……………………………. of truth and non-violence.
The burning rubber gave …………………. acrid smoke.
questions.description: To give off is to emit.

questions.question: I didn’t like the idea but I will ……………………… to it.
questions.description: To acquiesce is to consent or agree.

questions.question: The painting is the museum’s most recent …………………………
questions.description: An acquisition is a material possession.

questions.question: She is an ……………………… person, always wanting things.
The jury …………………….. the defendant of all charges.
questions.description: To acquit is to declare innocent.

questions.question: The fire department was called into ……………………….. when the alarm sounded.
The chameleon ………………………. to its surroundings by changing color.
The TV series is an …………………………. of a novel.
She is ………………………. at organizational work.
The meeting was …………………………… until tomorrow at 11 am.
It is ……………………….. for all children to have polio shots.
He and his brother are very much …………………….
One of the gems had a deep ……………………….
questions.description: Radiance means sheen or glitter. It is a noun.

questions.question: The sky was ………………………… in the morning.
questions.description: Radiant means shiny or bright. It is an adjective.

questions.question: It was a rather ……………………………. step.
The war ……………………………. for years.
He wore an old ………………………….. coat.
The farmer …………………………. cattle.
questions.description: Raise is a transitive verb. That means it is always followed by an object.

questions.question: It is not easy to ………………………….. orchids.
The cake won’t …………………………… unless you add yeast.
questions.description: Rise in intransitive. That means it is used without an object.

questions.question: Malaria is still ……………………………. in some swampy regions.
It was a …………………………. plan and bound to succeed.
I simply don’t understand the …………………………. of his plan.
We are …………………………….. for your long, newsy letter.
Collecting stamps gives him tremendous ………………………………..
How can I express my …………………………….. for your help?
The wheat was ………………………………. into flour.
questions.description: Ground is the past tense of grind.

questions.question: Singing in the shower is …………………………….. with him.
Have you ………………………………. the clothes yet?
questions.description: The past tense of hang is hung when we are talking about hanging things.

questions.question: That was ………………………………… the way to great a friend.
questions.description: Hardly can mean by no means.

questions.question: ………………………………… the doctor’s advice or you will be sorry.
The millionaire’s only ……………………………. was his son.
The family has a large ……………………………….. fortune.
A ……………………………. of food was found in the cave.
A …………………………… of Tartars invaded Europe.
questions.description: A horde is a mob or multitude.

questions.question: Put everything ……………………… the glasses in this box.
The child had an ………………………… of energy.
The student did ………………………… research before writing the paper.
The lease is ………………………… in saying that the rent must be paid by the 10th of every month.
It is not in the contract but it is ………………………. that the fee should be paid in advance.
questions.description: Implicit means implied but not directly stated.

questions.question: She ………………………. from the heat.
questions.description: To faint is to lose consciousness.

questions.question: She has a great ………………………… for writing.
After a quick ……………………….. of temper, the boy calmed down.
Her beauty is without …………………………
He was always ……………………………….. to the feelings of others.
questions.description: When you are insensitive, you are not sensitive.

questions.question: An ………………………….. confession was obtained through torture.
The doctor’s decision to operate proved to be …………………………………
The moderator maintained an ……………………………… manner throughout the furious debate.
questions.description: Impassive can mean calm or cool.

questions.question: The class was ………………………….. for the vacation to begin.
Try to remain ……………………………….. until you have heard both sides of the story.
The leader roused the protestors with an ………………………………….. speech.
Her parents …………………………… of her going to dances alone.
questions.description: Disapprove is the correct word. Disapprove means object to.

questions.question: The ………………………….. from the stitches was not too great.
The plot was too ………………………………. to make sense.
Her character is …………………………….
She was ………………………………. with her dull life.
The dense hedge of thorns formed an …………………………………. barrier around the castle.
She …………………………. his good name with ugly gossip.
The difference between the two colors is ………………………………
I have ……………………….. respect for him.
questions.description: Great is mainly used with abstract nouns.

questions.question: She has got rather ………………………….. eyes.
questions.description: Big and large are mainly used with concrete nouns.

questions.question: I …………………………….. a book from my sister.
questions.description: We borrow something from somebody. Loan has a similar meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………… me your pen for a minute, will you?
The job was hard but I …………………………… got used to it.
questions.description: Soon means ‘a short time after then’.

questions.question: ……………………………… that week, something suspicious occurred.
questions.description: Early means near the beginning of the time period that we are talking or thinking about.

questions.question: The train arrived 30 minutes ……………………………
questions.description: Early means before the expected time.

questions.question: You are never ………………………………
My watch is five minutes …………………………..
questions.description: A watch or a clock can be fast or slow.

questions.question: Do something ……………………………. He is bleeding.
questions.description: Quickly indicates the need to act urgently.

questions.question: Let’s meet ………………………………. next week.
I’m afraid it will take ……………………………… to repair the car.
questions.description: Some time means quite a lot of time.

questions.question: The retiring chairman received a …………………… from the new chairman.
questions.description: All of these words can mean praise.

questions.question: Because the old couple was …………………………… they never had to ask for financial help.
The car …………………………. the truck at 70 miles an hour.
questions.description: Passed is the past tense of pass.

questions.question: Did you see a car go …………………………….?
questions.description: Go past means go across one’s field of vision.

questions.question: Stamp collecting is an agreeable …………………………
The difference in their heights is hardly ……………………………….
Should parents be strict or ……………………….?
questions.description: Permissible means permitted. Permissive means lenient.

questions.question: Is this a business call or a …………………………….. one?
questions.description: Personal means belonging to a particular person.

questions.question: All ……………………… will receive an extra week’s vacation.
The …………………………….. were observed by astronomers throughout the world.
questions.description: Phenomena is plural phenomenon is singular.

questions.question: The disease was discovered in an early ……………………………..
Cook the beans with a ……………………………….. of salt pork.
questions.description: Piece means a portion or share.

questions.question: Ants love to eat …………………………
questions.description: A currant is a small berry used in buns.

questions.question: ……………………………. fashions are more casual than those of the 1960’s.
He gave the report a ……………………………… glance and tossed it aside.
questions.description: A cursory glance is a quick glance.

questions.question: He arrived with his ………………………………. promptness.
The nation must put a …………………………. on its spending to balance the economy.
questions.description: As a noun curb means restraint or control.

questions.question: His loss didn’t …………………………….. his zest for living.
questions.description: As a verb damp can mean reduce, diminish or depress. Dampen means the same.

questions.question: With that …………………………… outlook he does not trust anyone.
questions.description: Cynical means scornful, derisive or sarcastic.

questions.question: The negotiations reached a …………………………. after two hours.
questions.description: All of these words mean the same.

questions.question: The boy’s directions ……………………….. us, and we never did find the lake.
questions.description: To mislead someone is to give them false information unintentionally or unknowingly.

questions.question: She ……………………………. her fiancé by dating others.
questions.description: To deceive someone is to give them a false impression either knowingly or intentionally.

questions.question: The magazine doesn’t accept any ……………………………. ads.
From her conversation, I …………………………. that she had a large family.
It was such a ………………. state of affairs that we had to laugh.
The senator’s ………………… made him intolerant of other countries.
The teacher ………………… the child for arriving late.
questions.description: To chastise is to punish or scold. All of these words mean the same.

questions.question: Without rules, people would live in a state of ……………….
The minister made a ………………….. denial of the charges that he had taken bribes.
The plumber …………………. the job and now the pipe leaks.
questions.description: Bungle – do badly, make a mess of

questions.question: How can you believe such a ………………….. lie?
Buying the house without having it appraised was …………………
It is important to ............................. with those in trouble to really understand their suffering.
questions.description: To empathize is to share the feelings of another person.

questions.question: The spy checked into the hotel under a ............................ name.
The assassins often ..................... their victims.
The judge ordered him to ………………….. his dog.
There is something ………………….. about his past.
Her big eyes and ............................ questions made everyone feel protective toward her.
The true ......................... of his life was more exciting than fiction.
The fare they served would ..................... even a vulture.
He was punished for his ..................... deeds.
How can he be so ..................... . in all this trouble?
Tax collection agencies should be ...........................
There is little ....................... in his writing.
